result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael K. Fermanich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing, and Order Extending Probation For Unpaid Court Obligations

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael K. Fermanich in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF70, 15TR358, 15TR359 @ 10:27 a.m. 15TR358 and 15TR359 will be set for status conference on 12/15/15 @ 2:30 p.m. 15CF70 - Agreement stated - will amend ct 1 to 1st off poss of THC - eliminating enhancer - will plead to both cts.  Ct 1 - withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, counseling, court costs. Ct 2 - withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, counseling, court costs, 10 days jail, will not be asking for expungement. Atty Abernethy-Mays and Def agree. Plea quest. reviewed. Court grants motion to amend ct 1 eliminating enhancer. No contest plea. Ct 2 - no contest plea. Constitutional rights, elements and penalties. Atty Abernethy-Mays satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of ct 1 misd. possession of THC and ct 2 resisting or obstructing an officer. Counsel heard on sentencing. Nothing by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Court will follow agreement. Ct 1 - sentence withheld, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, counseling as required, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Ct 2 - sentence withheld, 1 yr probation, same conditions, DNA sample, 10 days jail, report no later than 6 p.m. on 2/1/16. Credit for 1 day served if revoked.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. Court is ordering court costs and DNA surcharge on ct 2.

Defendant Michael K. Fermanich in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls @ 2:39 p.m. Preliminary hrg.  Offc. Joseph Husnick duly sworn on oath, testifies. Witness identifies Defendant.  Stipulate prior conviction for purposes of this hearing. Arguments given. Court finds probable cause and binds over. Information filed. Copy received, reading waived, reserve all motions, not guilty pleas. Court receives pleas on both counts. 15TR358 and 15TR359 will track along.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Michael K. Fermanich in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, reviewed, waive reading.  Time limits for preliminary waived.   Bond continued  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Michael K. Fermanich in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews file.  Def working on obtaining counsel, unable to pay retainer.  Court questions if def contact public defender.  Court appointed atty explained.  Bond will continue  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael K. Fermanich in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def has been working on obtaining counsel.  Court will adj.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
